title: Task 38

question.text: What does Sophie imply by using may in her sentence?

answers.answer: She is sure about when the issue occurs.
answers.feedback: Using may suggests possibility, not certainty. Sophie is considering a potential occurrence, not stating a fact.

answers.answer: She thinks the problem might happen with large data sets.
She has ruled out large data sets as the cause of the issue.
answers.feedback: The use of may indicates that Sophie is considering large data sets as a potential cause, not ruling them out.

answers.answer: She has no idea about the cause of the issue.
answers.feedback: While may shows uncertainty, it doesn't mean she has no idea. She is suggesting a possible cause.

dialogue.text: I've noticed that the issue may occur when we handle large data sets.
